The Georgia Association of Broadcasters Unveils Details for the 2018 Beasley Media Group Radio Talent Institute

Atlanta, GA (April 25, 2018): The Georgia Association of Broadcasters (GAB) is pleased to unveil details for the 2018 Beasley Media Group Radio Talent Institute. The event will take place on Monday, May 7th through Wednesday, May 16th at the University of Georgia Grady College in Athens. Nineteen students will participate in nine days of intense training and learning from some of the best professionals in the media industry.

The National Radio Talent System and the Radio Talent Institute is the campus-to-career connection used by students to begin their broadcast career, as well as the connection for broadcasters to discover and hire entry-level talent today that will be leaders in the broadcast industry tomorrow. This year, the program will graduate its 100th student.

The GAB is thrilled to have Beasley Media Group as the official presenting sponsor of the 2018 Talent Institute.

“Students learn from the very people in our industry that do the hiring,” said GAB President Bob Houghton. “These young broadcasters are engaged, talented and are developing a passion for our Industry. I am thrilled we are doing this in Georgia and am grateful to Beasley Media Group for its support as the official sponsor of the Institute. It’s good for our industry, and hopefully will be done all over the country.”

“We are honored to support the Georgia Association of Broadcasters in this important initiative that underscores our company’s commitment to educating future broadcasters,” said Beasley Media Group Chief Executive Officer Caroline Beasley.

The students will have the opportunity to participate in a variety of informative sessions, including a tour SunTrust Park to meet with the Atlanta Braves marketing team and Atlanta Falcons play-by-play commentator, Wes Durham.

About the Georgia Association of Broadcasters:

The Georgia Association of Broadcasters (GAB) is the trade association that represents the interests of Georgia’s over-the-air radio and television licensees who reach more than 95% of Georgia’s population every week. Our membership is comprised of more than 250 radio and television broadcasters. GAB provides technical, regulatory, and advocacy support to our members as well as offering continuing professional enrichment opportunities designed to keep Georgia broadcasters at the forefront of the industry.
